page.title: 01GAZETTEER- SW.BOGNOR REGIS
page.content: {Bognor Regis}is a{sea-side resort situated in{West Sussex}on the South Coast. Before 1784 Bognor, or{Bognor Rocks as it was known then, was little more than a few fishermen's cottages.But in 1784{Sir Richard Hotham,}a Yorkshire hatter, visited the area and decided that it would make an ideal watering -place for the royalty and aristocracy of that time.He,therefore, set about building many fine{Georgian}homes some of which still remain today. During the{19th century}Bognor continued to expand as a sea-side resort as the{Victorian}middle-classes came to visit the town and take advantage of the sea-air and the mild climate. Following the convalescence of George V in 1929 the town was granted the title of{'Regis'.
